meanings.definition: A person or thing that reinvigorates.
meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, a walk in the park can be a reinvigorator.
meanings.sent2: The fresh cup of coffee was a much-needed reinvigorator in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The energetic puppy was a reinvigorator for the whole family.
meanings.sent4: Laughter can act as a reinvigorator for the soul.
meanings.sent5: Music has always been a powerful reinvigorator for me during tough times.

meanings.definition: To give new energy or strength to.
meanings.sent1: Exercise can reinvigorate your body and mind.
meanings.sent2: A good night's sleep can reinvigorate you for the day ahead.
meanings.sent3: The motivational speech reinvigorated the team before the big game.
meanings.sent4: The rain reinvigorated the dry soil, bringing life back to the garden.
meanings.sent5: The vacation reinvigorated her spirit, leaving her feeling refreshed and inspired.
